analysis:
Well, well, well – this is one of those trades that looks rather different in the rear-view mirror than it did at the time, doesn't it? Back in Week 5, finthefiddle, sitting pretty at the top of the table with a Power Score of 92, clearly thought they were consolidating their championship push. Trading away Chris Olave, who was averaging a modest 7.4 points per game, for Rachaad White – a proper running back averaging nearly 12 points – seemed sensible enough. Running backs are gold dust in fantasy, after all. But here's the thing: Olave has absolutely exploded post-trade, nearly doubling his output to 15.9 PPG, while White has regressed to 8.3. Jerry Jeudy hasn't helped matters either, dropping from 8.2 to 6.3. It's the sort of swing that makes you wince and reach for a strong cup of tea.

The winner here is quite clearly BigBishAl76, and it's not particularly close. They've gained nearly 3.8 points on their Power Score while finthefiddle has lost the same amount – that's a significant shift when you're talking about championship-caliber teams. What makes this especially painful is that both managers were in win-now mode, but one of them accidentally hit the accelerator while the other found reverse. BigBishAl76 essentially swapped underperforming assets for a star turn in Olave, and when you're the number two team chasing number one, that's precisely what you need. The depth hit they took doesn't matter much when you've just acquired someone scoring 16 points per game.

In two years' time, I suspect this trade will be remembered as the moment BigBishAl76's championship window truly opened. Olave, at 25, is just entering his prime years, while the players finthefiddle acquired are already on the decline – White's down to 8.3 PPG and Jeudy can't seem to find consistency in Cleveland. It reminds me a bit of the Amari Cooper trade from Oakland to Dallas back in 2018 – one team thought they were selling high on inconsistency, the other believed in the talent, and the belief paid immediate dividends. Sometimes in fantasy football, as in life, the best trades are the ones where you back quality over quantity. BigBishAl76 did exactly that, and finthefiddle, despite their impressive Power Score, may have just handed their closest rival the ammunition to catch them.
